bork

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • bork.Room

  • public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
    Constructs new Rooms and holds the methods needed to change or access the properties of any dungeon Room.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Constructs a room based off of data in the file attached to the given Scanner.
      Room(java.util.Scanner s, Dungeon d, boolean initState)
      Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of a "room" file entry, read and return a Room object representing it.

      A Room constructor that initializes with the Room title.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        Room(java.lang.String title)
        A Room constructor that initializes with the Room title.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the Room

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Constructs a room based off of data in the file attached to the given Scanner.
        Parameters:
        s - passed by the Dungeon constructor, this is the fileScanner reading the '.bork' file
        d - the Dungeon this Room belongs to
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException - The reader object is not positioned at the start of a room entry. A side effect of this is the reader's cursor is now positioned one line past where it was.
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException - A structural problem with the dungeon file itself, detected when trying to read this room.

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d,
     boolean initState)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of a "room" file entry, read and return a Room object representing it.
        Parameters:
        s - passed by the Dungeon constructor, this is the fileScanner reading the '.bork' file
        d - the Dungeon this Room belongs to, necessary to hydrate dungeon items
        initState - should items listed for this room be added to it?
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException - The reader object is not positioned at the start of a room entry. A side effect of this is the reader's cursor is now positioned one line past where it was.
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException - A structural problem with the dungeon file itself, detected when trying to read this room.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        Performs common object initialization including the Room contents, exits, and whether the player has visited the Room.

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title of this Room.
        Returns:
        The Room title.

      • setDesc

        void setDesc(java.lang.String desc)
        Sets a new description for this Room.
        Parameters:
        desc - the new description of the Room

      • storeState

        void storeState(java.io.PrintWriter w)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Store the current (changeable) state of this room to the writer passed.
        Parameters:
        w - received from the Dungeon storeState() method, this is the writer accessing '.sav' file being written to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If something goes wrong with reading or writing the file.

      • restoreState

        void restoreState(java.util.Scanner s,
                  Dungeon d)
           throws GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException
        Restores the save conditions of each room, including their contents and whether the player has visited the Room.
        Parameters:
        s - received from the Dungeon restoreState() method, this is the scanner accessing the '.sav' file being read from.
        d - the dungeon associated with the '.sav' file
        Throws:
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException - Signals an illegal format for the save file

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe()
        Gets the description of this Room if the player has not visited it yet as well as the contents and exits of this Room.
        Returns:
        an appropriate description of the Room and its contents

      • leaveBy

        public Room leaveBy(java.lang.String dir)
        Gets the Room that the Player reaches when they travel through the Exit in the given direction, if there is an exit there.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction in which the player is trying to exit
        Returns:
        the Room that the Player reaches when they travel through the Exit in the given direction

      • addExit

        void addExit(Exit exit)
        Adds a new Exit to this Room.
        Parameters:

      • getItemNamed

        Item getItemNamed(java.lang.String name)
           throws Item.NoItemException
        Gets an item that goes by the given name from the contents of this Room.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the item to retrieve
        Returns:
        an item that goes by the given name from the contents of room
        Throws:
        Item.NoItemException - If there are no more items in this Room.
